intro: Ecbolium geniculatum, commonly known as the twisted spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Ecbolium geniculatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
